author: aeromoe
title: Stormtrooper keyring turned battle ready mini fig.
review:
Short but sweet.  I bought 10 of these keyrings at my local Lego Store.  I used diagonal cutters (dikes for short) to snip the metal right above the helmet.  Helmet easily removed, then remove the head to snip the remaining protruding metal at the top of the "neck" post.  I filled the resulting very neat hole in the top of the helmet with some white styrene rod I have on hand.   If you insert the styrene from the bottom and snip it off you'll have to push it up further with the mini fig with head on so it'll fit properly.  If you insert from the top of the helmet, don't push in so far that it goes into the hole on top of the head too far and contacts the neck post.  

I glued the styrene in place from the inside with some liquid plastic modeler's cement and snipped the protruding styrene off on the top of the helmet.   A little fine sandpaper action on the top to even things up and no one is the wiser, for the most part.  Of the 10 I did last night, I glued some of the helmets in place.  I may do the rest in due course.


This is a reasonably cost-effective way to build a small army of these Stormtroopers.
